title: Make your match history private feature
body:
I dont know about you, but when I go on  a losing streak or the last games ive played have been completele fails,i dont really want strangers/friends to look and go "oh wooow soooo bad lmaoo"

Should this be a new feature?

replies.body: No it shouldn't, if you can't take any criticism then you shouldn't be playing a competetive game, you know what you do to people that give you shit? You ignore them, is that not simple enough? We all have losing streaks, we all tilt even the best players, yes even Faker, everyone who plays this game experiences bad games from time to time, shit happens.

"if you can't take any criticism then you shouldn't be playing a competetive game"

I think he got a few....lols

You can do that, but at the end of the day it is a competetive game not your casual CoD where nobody gives a shit if you fail or not, if you fail in LoL people will give you shit for it that's just the nature of competetive games, people get mad when you do bad.

This mentality is a catalyst of negative attitudes/behaviour that plagues Oce and League in general.

Players are entitled to play for whatever reason they like no?
I am 30 years old and I have been gaming for 25 years. Of course I enjoy the team aspect and I'll always respect the fact that there are players who are serious and want you to perform well so they can win. However, there are the other type, who enjoy playing a finely made game as a form of relaxation and joy. A loss can be fun, breaking the Meta and inadvertently feeding can be fun and no matter how hard some practice, there should never be big expectations for MLG plays to be made daily.

Just remember, if people get mad at you when you are trying your best, it is them who are failing. Perhaps not at the technicalities of the game, but at being a good spirited teammate. We all know that flames are part of a fire. So flinging sh*t or blaming someone elses ability is in fact much more of a detriment to the League experience as a whole. If this culture was lifted, the Oce community would flourish. In turn, more and more "bad" players would be encouraged and taught, rather than shunned and abused.



And.......      *Competitive

No it isn't, this is how all competitive games work, people who play for their rank want to win games and it gets frustrating when a player simply doesn't give a fuck and ruins your game, if you don't give a fuck then stay away from competitive games, nothing wrong with someone getting mad at another person as long as you don't rage and start being abusive and whatnot it is completely fine to be mad at someone and start criticizing, for example if i fucked up and someone calls me out on it and says "you really fucked us up there" i'm not gonna turn around and rage at the person, i'm going to accept i fucked up cause i know it was my fault, if you wanna be a baby and cry at every little thing someone says then you need to get off the internet.

No they aren't, what if i want to play just to troll people? Think about that for a minute, you want to relax? Play a game mode where no one cares if you lose or not, that's called normals, ranked is for those that want to win not for those that don't give a shit, a loss in ranked is not fun, period, what the hell are you smoking? If the person is having fun feeding then he should and will be reported for intentionally feeding, you think feeding is fun but your four team mates don't, that's the stupidest thing to say, you obviously care about yourself and not others, there should always be expectations for someone to play good depending on your ranking.

If people get mad at you then you mute them, they aren't failing at all they are frustrated that you're ruining the game for them but them raging at you is a different story, they can be mad all they want as long as they don't show it in game its fine, no it isn't a detriment to the league experience at all, if you for instance keep pushing and not warding then dying over and over again it is your fault and your team has every right to blame you, you know what you can do when someone tells you you're fucking up by not warding and pushing? You listen to them, you acknowledge that you have fucked up and you listen to them, you stop pushing and you start buying wards, don't be a cry baby whenever someone tells you you're doing something wrong, if you're fucking up you will be corrected and if you refuse to listen and continue to fuck up then it is your fault, theres a difference between "shunned and abused" and criticized, if you cant take criticism then quite frankly you need to grow up.

I don't think it would be difficult for Rito to add a "disable" checkbox in the client..

However, like JasonWazza touched on, maybe they have obligations to 3rd party sites that would prevent it idk?

>However, like JasonWazza touched on, maybe they have obligations to 3rd party sites that would prevent it idk?

I'm gonna touch on more why it can't work.

With how the API works places like OP.GG get the info of my games, however if this was a feature they would have to get rid of every game that had someone in it with private match history on this means sites like OP.GG can't exist and Riot has already said they have no problems with them.

Why should it be private?

Fact is you couldn't make it fully private due to the API and things like OP.GG, lolking, leagueofgraphs etc. existing but fact is their should be no reason to hide your match history, everyone goes on losing streaks, it doesn't really matter that heavily.

i totally agree with making the match history private for everyone who doesnt want his matches to be public. i think riot should focus a bit more on privacy than making 5-6 champs per year !!! i hope riot checks this thread and figure out that an option to make match history private is not only a good idea but in my opinion a must

I think a very large part of the issue is also the difficulty of interpreting the emotions behind a message in a textual medium. Say some chill bloke sees that you are overextending too much and going in too early, too him he is still chill so any message he sends too himself will be a chill one as if he were talking irl. But this is a text based sentence so there is no "tone" to discern so he may say "Stop going too far out past your tower and you keep going in too early" now to him that is just some friendly advice. Now say the person receiving it (like a lot of the LoL community) is a negative type of guy he sees this as some anger driven personal attack on him and completely loses it and from there the situation just deteriorates.

I personally would just not give a fuck but for people like yourself the best option is to use the mute feature on random people who wanna talk shit, also if your friends are asshats about a bad game you had just point out one of their bad games or tell them to fk themselves lol.
